Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the event log the activities are OR MS QS AS IQC TST RT PK LB DP D. From the examples In case 1 the sequence is OR MS QS AS IQC AS TST RT TST PK LB DP D. In case 2 LB is skipped. In case 3 there are multiple IQC and RT steps. In case 4 theres no IQC or RT it goes OR MS QS AS TST PK LB DP D. In case 5 there are multiple RT steps. So the process seems to start with OR then MS QS and AS. Then theres a loop involving IQC and AS. After some iterations it moves to TST. If the test fails RT is done leading back to TST. Then PK and optionally LB then DP then D.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In case 2 LB is skipped. So LB is optional. Also in some cases IQC is not present case 4 so maybe IQC and the loop with AS is not always present.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: the loop operator in POWL is defined as * (A B) and tells that you execute A then either you exit the loop or execute B and then A again repeating until the loop is exited. So for the AS-IQC loop perhaps the loop is * (AS IQC). Similarly for the testing phase * (TST RT).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: the loop * (AS IQC) would model AS then either exit or IQC and loop back to AS. Similarly * (TST RT) is TST then either exit or RT and loop back to TST.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: in case 4 the AS-IQC loop is skipped or maybe its always present but sometimes IQC is not triggered so the loop exits immediately after AS. Yes that makes sense.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now lets try to outline the process Start with OR MS QS [AS-IQC loop] [TST-RT loop] PK [option for LB] DP D. In case 1 AS IQC AS fits A B A. In case 3 AS IQC AS IQC AS fits A B A B A. In case 4 AS only fits A then exit. In case 2 choice takes skip.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: LB activity is optional so X (LB skip) where skip is a silent transition. The root is a StrictPartialOrder with nodes OR MS QS Loop1 Loop2 PK Choice DP D and order OR MS QS Loop1 Loop2 PK Choice DP D.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: This seems to cover all cases. No concurrent activities all sequential so partial order is a total order chain.
